intro: Pleurothallis guanacastensis, commonly known as the Guanacaste orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Central America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in humid, shaded forest environments. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. It has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
